nodes.bodyText: @Operation has a nested @ApiResponse that can describe response codes. For that matter, these should described in OpenAPI
Refresh my memory from the presentation, why are duplicates not a concern with the new approach?
It is more so that this test assumes that service stubs exist which is no longer the case.
If the workflow already exists on Dockstore in the new model, one will not be created, but a new version will be added.
I'd prefer this to be non-nullable and just set to a n/a term or similar by default.
Would I have a subclass called not applicable?
Can get rid of this kind of thing and error prone null checks
initializeWorkflow can be more descriptive if this is for github app installs only

Use https://github.com/dockstore/dockstore/blob/develop/dockstore-common/src/main/java/io/dockstore/common/DescriptorLanguage.java#L146 or similar so that we don't need to touch this when we need to get Galaxy in here too.
Ditto
This can use https://github.com/dockstore/dockstore/pull/3235/files#diff-fd5ac5b6f6fdba95c1c5be457e049d7dR207 after my merge
Non descriptive variable names

Please write a test with a 1.1 and 1.2 schema file checked-in. I think we can make some quick decisions to make 1.2 support both and be compatible (i.e. can switch the version number from 1.1 to 1.2 to "upgrade", a 1.2 file can be read as a 1.1 file since your new keys should just be ignored)

I do have tests for schema 1.1 for services and 1.2 for workflows. Do you mean have one a test that has both 1.1 and 1.2 services? I was hoping that the 1.2 services could be added in the next PR since I didn't want this one getting too big.
LAMBDA_ERROR = HttpStatus.Teapot or w/e?
I wonder if the name should have something to indicate workflow in it? What if we add support for tools and dockstore.yml?

nodes.bodyText: LOG.error and log the exception
If you come in here, don't you want to thrown an exception? Otherwise it will go ahead and create the workflow on line 369.
Good catch
It was like this, so assume it's OK, but just double checking -- we are not handling Nextflow here on purpose, right?
I am pretty sure nextflow does not yet (or at least at the time) have checker workflow implementation.
Suggest LOG.error
Probably LOG.error here as well, although this may become moot when we create classes for dockstore.yml
I wonder if we shouldn't have OTHER as well. The service definition is pretty agnostic to the technology. But I'm not sure what anybody would do with OTHER, so I'm torn.
